channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republicans line up behind Trump after US strikes Venezuela, Maduro arrested: 'Changed the course of history'
item.description: Republicans in Congress are lining up behind President Donald Trump's actions in Venezuela.

item.title: House Democrat calls Trump's Maduro capture 'welcome news' as left labels it 'illegal'
item.description: Most Democrats are blasting the Trump administration after the U.S. conducted an operation to capture Venezuela's leader, Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Minneapolis Daycares Only the Tip of the Fraud Scandal
item.description: Nick Shirley’s viral video is useful, but the focus should be on nailing as many of the malefactors as possible.

item.title: Trump-aligned super PAC enters 2026 midterms with nearly $300M war chest
item.description: The Trump-aligned super PAC reported nearly $300 million in cash on hand in a new FEC filing as Republicans gear up for the 2026 midterm elections.

item.title: French tourists didn’t believe the young guy on the subway was New York City’s new mayor, so he held up the newspaper to prove it
item.description: Zohran Mamdani also has to move to the mayor's mansion on the Upper East Side before the lease in Queens apartment ends later this month.

item.title: Trump has been laying the groundwork for a strike on Venezuela for a full year. Here’s the timeline
item.description: President Donald Trump had long threatened that he could order military strikes on targets on Venezuelan territory after months of attacks on boats ac...

item.title: Nicolas Maduro rose from bus driver to president before presiding over Venezuela’s economic collapse
item.description: In 1986, Maduro traveled to Cuba for a year of ideological instruction, his only formal education after high school. He quickly became a union leader.

item.title: What happens next in Venezuela? The regime’s foundation remains in place even after U.S. capture of Maduro, analyst says
item.description: "So removing Maduro did not necessarily change the fundamental equation of control."

item.title: Strange Days at the Modern Language Association
item.description: Sadly, the organization’s upcoming conference will further delegitimize the humanities.

item.title: ICE highlights ‘best of the best’ agents who jumped into action at crash sites

item.title: Highs and Lows at Princeton’s New Art Museum
item.description: It looks great, but is the curatorial vision awry?

item.title: You probably use the same password for 30 different websites. It’s time for a passkey.
item.description: Many companies think of passkeys as just a security upgrade, but they’re really a crucial user experience initiative.

item.title: Minnesota faces funding deadline after Trump administration freezes childcare payments
item.description: Minnesota officials face a Jan. 9 deadline to turn over childcare funding records after the Trump administration froze payments amid fraud allegations...

item.title: It’s Time To Cancel Our Subscription Culture Once And For All
item.description: A new cancel culture is coming. Consumerism, bad customer service, and corporations beware!

item.title: Trump's triumphal arch project could start soon
item.description: President Trump said construction for his planned Triumphal Arch in Washington is set to begin early in the new year.

item.title: One Man’s ‘Warmth of Collectivism’ Is Another’s Inferno
item.description: The authors of Mamdani’s inaugural address appear to genuinely believe true socialism has never been tried.

item.title: Let Freedom Ring in the Caribbean in 2026
item.description: From Venezuela to Cuba to Nicaragua, new opportunities.

item.title: Trump shops for marble while in Florida
item.description: President Trump made a pit stop at a marble shop while in Florida on Friday, with plans to use the rock for the planned White House State Ballroom.

item.title: It’s Not Just Minnesota. The Vast Majority Of Daycare Is A Scam
item.description: Taxpayers have spent hundreds of billions more on completely ineffective daycare than even Somalis have been able to pilfer.

item.title: Without George Washington, America Wouldn’t Have A 250th Birthday
item.description: No one looms larger in the story of our nation's struggle for independence than George Washington, who today seems almost mythical.
